lead_paragraph: VAN BUREN--William Benjamin III. March 25, 1922 - February 26, 2016. William Benjamin Van Buren III, of Austin, Texas, passed away peacefully on February 26, 2016, at the age of 93. William "Bill" was born in Brooklyn, NY, and grew up in Plainfield, NJ. He graduated from Washington and Lee University in 1944 with a B.A. in Economics, and was elected to Phi Beta Kappa. Bill enlisted with the U.S. Naval Service in 1942, serving four years in the U.S. Navy as a Communications Officer and 1st Lieutenant. During WWII, Bill saw active duty aboard the USS Simpson, a destroyer, in the Atlantic Ocean. After the war, Bill attended Yale University Law School and graduated with an LLB in 1949. He began his legal profession in New York City and was admitted to the New York State Bar in 1950. Bill's major career tenure was with Merck & Co., Inc. His career with Merck spanned over 30 years, where he held various corporate legal and senior management positions, from Director of Corporate Development to Senior Vice President. Bill was greatly respected and admired for his exceptional intelligence, discernment, and integrity. He had the utmost respect for Merck and and all of its great accomplishments, corporate culture and management. Bill retired from Merck in 1986. All his life, Bill was very athletic and played many sports, particularly high school and college baseball. Bill loved music and had very broad and eclectic appreciation. All who knew him will remember his quick wit and enduring sense of humor. Bill was predeceased by his eldest daughter, Susan, in 1976, and his first wife, Joan, in 1997. He is survived by his second wife, Norma A. Van Buren of Duluth, GA; his daughter Patricia Van Buren and husband John M. Almond of The Hills, TX; son William S. Van Buren, and wife Donna, of Seattle, WA; son Richard W. Van Buren and wife Leslie, of Austin, TX; and his four grandchildren. A memorial service for Mr. Van Buren will be held at Westlake Hills Presbyterian Church in Austin, TX on Saturday, March 5, 2016 at 1:00pm. The service will be followed by visitation with the family. Interment will be at Hillside Cemetery in Scotch Plains, NJ. In lieu of flowers, please consider donations to the Alzheimer's Association at www.alz.org or the American Cancer Society at www.cancer.org. Services are being handled by Weed-Corley-Fish of Austin. Obituary and memorial guestbook available online at www.wcfish.com. 1/3
